HTMLInputElementValidationMessage.summary: The validationMessage read-only property of the interface returns a string representing a localized message that describes the validation constraints that the {{htmlelement("input")}} control does not satisfy (if any).

remarks.para: If the <input> element is not a candidate for constraint validation ( is false), or it satisfies its constraints, the value is the empty string ("").

If the element is a candidate for constraint validation (willValidate is true) and the constraints are not met (the object's valid property is false), the value is the error message that would be shown to the user during validation.
